section:
In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows:
The agreed upon repayment amount per event per calendar year:
1. Year 1. $[*****]
2. Year 2 $[*****]
3. Year 3 $[*****]
4. Year 4 $[*****]
5. Year 5 $[*****]
B.Payment shall be made to ADAMS GOLF within three months following the end of the calendar year. For example, if in the calendar year 2005 CONSULTANT achieves a satisfactory record of play in [*****] events, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF [*****] dollars no later than March 31, 2006.
C.In the event that CONSULTANT is prevented from competing for reasons outside his control, the parties agree to a good faith attempt to resolve the issues. If a resolution can not be reached, ADAMS GOLF may, at its sole discretion, demand prorated repayment pursuant to the repayment schedule in paragraph 8A above.
explanation: The text states that the consultant must achieve a satisfactory record of play. This introduces ambiguity as there are no parameters to define what a satisfactory record of play looks like. The first sentence states the consultant must play in a minimum number of events, but the term 'satisfactory' indicates a qualitative aspect that could be interpreted in multiple ways. Further, section 8C introduces the possibility of prorated repayment if the consultant is prevented from competing for reasons outside his control. This contradicts the earlier statement that the consultant must repay a certain amount if they play in less than the minimum number of events because the prorated repayment for reasons outside of his control may not be the same amount as if he willingly chose to not play.

section:
In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows:
The agreed upon repayment amount per event per calendar year:
1. Year 1. $[*****]
2. Year 2 $[*****]
3. Year 3 $[*****]
4. Year 4 $[*****]
5. Year 5 $[*****]
B.Payment shall be made to ADAMS GOLF within three months following the end of the calendar year. For example, if in the calendar year 2005 CONSULTANT achieves a satisfactory record of play in [*****] events, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF [*****] dollars no later than March 31, 2006.
C.In the event that CONSULTANT is prevented from competing for reasons outside his control, the parties agree to a good faith attempt to resolve the issues. If a resolution can not be reached, ADAMS GOLF may, at its sole discretion, demand prorated repayment pursuant to the repayment schedule in paragraph 8A above.
explanation: The phrase 'reasons outside his control' is a vague term. It creates an ambiguity because it is unclear which reasons would qualify as 'outside his control'. This can be seen as a legal contradiction because it is difficult to determine which circumstances would trigger the prorated repayment, potentially leading to disputes.

section: For the entire term of this Agreement, from September 1, 2004 through [*****] ADAMS GOLF shall pay CONSULTANT a base compensation of [*****] dollars. The base compensation shall be paid upon completion of each calendar year of the contract.
explanation: The first sentence establishes that the base compensation is for the entire term of the agreement but the second sentence says the compensation will be paid upon completion of each calendar year of the contract. This introduces a contradiction in text. The first sentence suggests a lump-sum payment at the end of the entire agreement term, while the second sentence implies annual payments. The contradiction lies in the timing of the payment, which is inconsistently defined.

section: For the entire term of this Agreement, from September 1, 2004 through [*****] ADAMS GOLF shall pay CONSULTANT a base compensation of [*****] dollars. The base compensation shall be paid upon completion of each calendar year of the contract.
explanation: The terms of payment are not clear. The phrase "upon completion of each calendar year of the contract" is ambiguous as it does not specify the exact date by which the payment should be made. This lack of a specific deadline could lead to disputes over when the payment is considered late.

section: Notwithstanding any other paragraph of this Agreement, if either party commits any material breach of this Agreement, the other party may terminate for cause upon giving fifteen (15) days written notice of such cause and provided the breach is not rectified within such thirty (30) day period. Upon such termination, CONSULTANT shall be required to repay ADAMS GOLF for that period of the Agreement not performed by CONSULTANT. The repayment amount shall be calculated in the same way as repayment is calculated under paragraph 8A.
explanation: The text provides contradictory information. It states that the breaching party has thirty (30) days to rectify the breach, but also states they have fifteen (15) days written notice of such cause. The phrase 'thirty (30) day period' suggests that the termination becomes effective 30 days after the notice, regardless of whether the breach is rectified. This contradicts the condition that the breach must not be rectified within this period for termination to occur.

section: Notwithstanding any other paragraph of this Agreement, if either party commits any material breach of this Agreement, the other party may terminate for cause upon giving fifteen (15) days written notice of such cause and provided the breach is not rectified within such thirty (30) day period. Upon such termination, CONSULTANT shall be required to repay ADAMS GOLF for that period of the Agreement not performed by CONSULTANT. The repayment amount shall be calculated in the same way as repayment is calculated under paragraph 8A.
explanation: The concept of 'material breach' is not precisely defined. The term is a legal term but the contract does not provide any further clarification or examples, leading to ambiguity in its interpretation and application. It is unclear what constitutes a 'material breach,' making it difficult to determine when termination is justified.
